Battlestar.Galactica.Razor.Flashbacks.Complete.v3.1080p.6ch.x265.HEVC

Battlestar Galactica Razor Flashbacks single file fanedit
version3 18min21sec Handbrake0.10.2.7286 292,248,052bytes
source: Blu-Ray 480p/1080p
video: 1920x1080 HEVC crf=26 preset=medium
audio: 6-channel 5.1 HE-AAC 256Kbps
  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1334430/  

suggested viewing order:
s2e17 The Captain's Hand
s2e17.3 Razor (101 minute movie extended version from the blu-ray)
s2e17.7 Razor Flashbacks Complete v3
s2e18 Downloaded

This fanedit is the Razor Flashbacks from Battlestar Galactica in a single 18minute 21second file formatted as one episode. The source for this fanedit was the excellent Battlestar Galactica Blu-Ray set and used the 1080p/5.1 Razor (Unrated) movie and the 480p/2.0 Razor Flashbacks. All of the Razor Flashbacks episodes 3, 4, 5, 6 and part of 7 are contained within the Razor (Unrated) movie which is 1080p with surround sound.

00.00-02.30 Razor Flashbacks episode1 480p
02.30-04.54 Razor Flashbacks episode2 480p
04.54-15.08 Razor (Unrated) 1080p
15.08-18.21 Razor Flashbacks episode7 480p

Episode7 only has 1minute 17seconds of content, the rest is credits and the hilarious R&D TV stinger at the very end:
15.07-16.25 Razor Flashbacks episode7 flash forward to Galactica's decommissioning
16.25-18.16 Razor Flashbacks credits
18.16-18.20 R&D TV stinger with David saying "me, me, me ..." and Ron pushing his stomach in and saying "big head"

Changes:
* hid the "TO BE CONTINUED" text overlays and removed the associated sound effects at the end of episode 1 and episode 2
* removed the episode 2 establishing shot of an exterior zoom into Galactica
* left the very funny R&D stinger from the very end of episode 7 after the credits; this R&D stinger wasn't used at the end of any normal episodes so it's a bit of an Easter Egg

Note: The webisodes are stereo 2.0 and the Razor (Unrated) material is surround 5.1. The final file is mastered as 5.1 and the sound levels sound about right with surround speakers but listening with just stereo speakers might make the webisodes sound a bit louder than the movie portion. If the video player has a speaker setting, be sure to set it to 2.0 if you only have stereo speakers.

************************************************************

VERSION6 HAS ENG CZE GRE ITA SUBTITLES ADDED
THE VIDEO CROPPING IS SLIGHTLY LESS THAN V5

Battlestar Galactica The Face of the Enemy single file fanedit
version6 33min52sec Handbrake0.10.2.7286 443,198,845bytes
source: Japanese Blu-Ray 1080i
video: 1920x1072 HEVC crf=23 preset=medium
audio: 2-channel stereo HE-AAC 96Kbps
subtitles: built in, off by default, not hard coded - English, Czech, Greek, Italian
chapters: 10 chapters, 1 for each webisode
  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1338724/  

suggested viewing order:
s4e11 Sometimes a Great Notion
s4e11.5 The Face Of The Enemy Complete v6
s4e12 A Disquiet Follows My Soul 

The story is powerful, both Gaeta (Alessandro Juliani) and Sweet Eight (Grace Park) do great jobs and we finally find out what Baltar whispered into Gaeta's ear in the brig that made him attack Baltar. This is best viewed in between s4e11 and s4e12. Since the parts are all strung together some unneeded establishing shots were cut as were some overlapping clips.

This is the sixth (and final?) edit and encode of Battlestar Galactica's The Face of the Enemy 10 webisode series. This new version6 used the very best source: the newly available Japanese Battlestar Galactica Season 4 Blu-ray Box Set and was encoded with x265 HEVC video. The edges of the source have thin black lines or are ragged but with v6 slightly less cropping was used compared to v5 and the edges still look good. There are 10 named chapter markers so it is easy to navigate to each webisode's content.

Subtitles were added to version6. These subtitles were create by the Internet community for English, Czech, Greek, and Italian. All 4 subtitles were carefully resynched at the start and end of the video and checked in several places. I do not understand most of the last 3 languages so there might be translation issues. Also, I did not carefully check the English subs but they look pretty good. Thank you for creating these!

SPECIAL THANKS: a very special thanks to the poster of this Blu-Ray source and for the 4 subtitles. Thank you!

************************************************************
